sub_topic: Determining the bond enthalpy of a molecule
message_1: What is the bond enthalpy of the O-H bond in a water molecule and what is the energy required to break this bond?
message_2: The bond enthalpy of the O-H bond in a water molecule is approximately 463 kJ/mol. This means that it requires 463 kJ of energy to break one mole of O-H bonds in water molecules.
